text: Hi folks! Patrick Hirst from HubSpot here. I'm a Principal Channel Consultant on our AP Customer Success team and I'm reaching out to this community on behalf of a partner I manage. My partner is looking for feedback on ADA Compliance. Has anyone here successfully made a HubSpot website ADA compliant? If so, would you be willing to jump on a short call with a fellow HS partner?

I can’t do a call, and haven’t been legally required to make a HubSpot site ADA compliant but I would highly recommend passing along these sites to that partner.

<https://a11yproject.com/> - site about everything accessibility, shows example code patterns

<http://wave.webaim.org/> - free tool that points out some issues you have on your site. it has a pretty outdated design but it’s still fairly useful.

<https://css-tricks.com/improving-accessibility-24-ways/> - blog post going over some basics that are very important

another quick suggestion that may be worthwhile to ensure compliancy and quality, there are a lot of companies that do consultation for ADA Compliance - it’s worth paying for as Accessibility is a really in-depth topic when it comes to websites.
<@UFFE4CJFJ> also tell them to use this site: <http://SiteImprove.com|SiteImprove.com>
Hi, is it possible for a CTA button to pop-up a form?
No it is not. If you want to pop open a model or a form you will have to use a regular button/link.
<@UFDB0A919> thanks for your bump, please see <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Blog-Template-Modularly/m-p/246519/highlight/true#M10659>
